column4: How can I replace that awful Nautilus for something really usable?
if you don't like the way it looks, use a different theme.  If you don't like the widgets, try dolphin, thunar or pcmanfm I guess
~/.dmrc iirc, but you should just use gdm to change it
no, I cannot get to any session after X startup
well you can go into recovery mode and stop X from starting there with sysv-rc-conf
don't let the gdm service start
nano, vim, and emacs are the more popular ones
if latest software versions are a priority for you, then you should be using the latest stable release of ubuntu, not one almost 2 years old :)
I would gladly use it but 8.04 is the last OS which support my videocard
